doc.name: KeyWriter
doc.description:
Read in a Key from the input port and write it out to a KeyStore.

Keystores are ways to manage keys and certificates. See the ptolemy.actor.lib.security.KeyStoreActor documentation for more information about keystores.

The input is of type ptolemy.actor.lib.security.KeyToken. This actor does not support writing PublicKeys because PublicKeys require certificates. Instead, to write a PublicKey/PrivateKey pair to a keystore, use the keytool executable. Currently, this actor only support writing SecretKeys and PrivateKeys to a keystore.
doc.author: Christopher Brooks
doc.port: The input port, which contains on KeyToken.
The output port, which contains a True boolean token when the key has been written.
